title: JAM Session 1219 Customizing Your AD to RE Transfer Process.pdf
docSource: pdf file uploaded by the user.
pageContent: © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Customizing the AD to RE Transfer  Presented by Rebecca McCollum Union Institute & University  6/2/2016 – Dallas, TX © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Who is responsible?  At Union we elected to have the Admissions office send the data because we wanted the transfer to occur at the same time as the completion of the student’s physical file, and we “hand off” the two simultaneously © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  The selection process – who is transferred and when?  By Infomaker Query – Allows for high selectivity and specificity  By individual candidate(s)  By query within AD-RE Transfer window © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Settings – Insert vs. Update  Process Controls   Degree History & Div Master Insert/Update Options © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  What information transfers are available?  Candidacy: Yr/Trm  Candidacy: Location  Candidacy: Housing Cde  Candidacy: Deposit Amt  Organizations: End date of HS listed  Candidacy: Program  Candidate: Last Org Attended  Candidacy: Degree  Candidacy: Tuition Status © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  The “profiles” for the AD to RE transfer (including the settings, the selection process, and which data goes) must be saved on each user’s machine. If multiple people are running the same profiles, be certain that the profiles are identical  Please note... © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  ....... CUSTOMIZATION!  And now what we’ve all been waiting for.... © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Which fields are not updated by the transfer?     Admit Program     Concentration     Certification     Entrance Code     Holds     Non-degree checkbox     User-defined fields © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Create New Term of Courses      Update Definition  1)   In the first column ( update type ), right click to go to the Maintenance screen. This will take you to the Maintain Table Values Window  2)   Right click to add a row. Create an update type using your school’s initials. Save and close the window.  Step 1: Update Type © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Create New Term of Courses      Update Definition  1)   Right Click to Add a Row  2)   Update Type: Select the new type you just added  3)   Update Code: Create a code identifying what the rule will be updating (Admit Program, Certificate, etc.)  4)   Process Type: Update  5)   Target Table: Identify the table that holds the field to be updated  6)   Target Column: Identify the column (field) to be updated  Step 2: Update Definition © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  View of Completed Rules (one for each field update) © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Step 3: Update Definition User Access  Create New Term of Courses      Update Definition User Access  Select the group you are in (and any other groups that run the AD- RE transfer). Drag from left to right all of the codes you just created. Save. © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Step 4: Update Results and Rules  Create New Term of Courses      Update Results and Rules  1)   Select an update type from the top window (for example, CERT)  2)   On the Results Definition tab, right click to add as many rows as possible resulting codes (if you have 3 certificate values, add 3 rows).  3)   Note that the update table/column that you provided is listed in the header  4)   Enter each resulting code you want to go into the destination table during the transfer © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Update Results/Rules View © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  1)   Highlight one of your “resulting code” rows  2)   Select the “Results Rules Definition” tab  3)   On the Rules Table/Column/Expression column enter the corresponding field that will determine the update definition. For example, if you are recording concentrations in a udef field, list the udef field to which that the transfer refers  4)   Write the rules. You can create AND and OR statements if necessary (For example, candidacy.prog_cde = BSM AND candidacy.dept_cde = MKT). A positive outcome for the rules will result in the code being populated in the target field.  Updating Results and Rules, cont. © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Writing the Rules: © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Create New Term of Courses      Update Cluster Definition  1)   In the Cluster to Maintain section, right click to add a row.  2)   Create a cluster code (i.e. ADR) and assign a group that has access to this cluster.  3)   Move all of your AD to RE codes from “Available Codes” to “Selected Codes.” They are now part of the cluster that can be selected when you run the AD to RE transfer.  Step 5: Update Cluster Definition © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Cluster Definition View © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Select your new cluster! © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Q&A © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan  Rebecca McCollum  Project Manager  Union Institute & University  513-487-1186  Rebecca.mccollum@myunion.edu  Contact Information
